description: Made by Hama, assisted by Ranthalos and Meteor w/ technical stuff
name: Part 3: Basic PvE Weapon rolls to look for

data.description: Ritual Weapon from Lost, good option for casual content, but not ideal for DPS scenarios.
data.name: Ascendancy

data.description: Solid Rapid Fire Fusion if you want a Reservoir Burst option.
data.name: Null Composure

data.description: Amazing GL from Chosen. Special GL's with Chain Reaction is pretty rare and being paired with Ambitious Assassin makes this pretty much as good of a roll you can ask for. You also have the option of Vorpal and Demo which makes this already overloaded gun even more versatile.
data.name: Salvager's Salvo

data.description: Very good general Rocket Launcher with Auto-Loading. Lasting Impression vs Frenzy for dmg comes down to preference, but personally I like Frenzy a lot. Quick / Smart Drift are my recommended Barrels and for Mags I'd say Impact Casing is best, but Implosion / High Velocity is also fine. Chain Reaction can be fun for ad clear purposes. Recommended MW: Handling.
data.name: Code Duello

data.description: Very good general Rocket Launcher with Field Prep which allows you to hold an extra rocket. Lasting Impression vs Frenzy for dmg comes down to preference, but personally I like Frenzy a lot. Quick / Smart Drift are my recommended Barrels and for Mags I'd say Impact Casing is best, but Implosion / High Velocity is also fine. Chain Reaction can be fun for ad clear purposes. Recommended MW: Handling.
data.name: Code Duello

data.description: Shadow Price has a couple solid perk options. Personally I prefer One For All, but Swash is also okay. Feeding Frenzy is your go to in the 3rd column, but Overflow / Surplus are also good options. Arrowhead / Fluted for Barrels and Accurized / Flared for Mags. Recommended MW: Range.
data.name: Shadow Price

data.description: For Arc Logic I think you're either opting into Rampage / Adren Junkie for dmg, while Demo is for Nade builds. You'd want to pair Adren Junkie / Rampage / Demo with Feeding Frenzy, Subsistence or Overflow. Frenzy is an option if with Subsistence or Overflow. Arrowhead / Fluted are my recommended Barrels and Accurized / Flared for Mags. Recommended MW: Range.
data.name: Arc Logic

data.description: Very fun Sword to run around with in PvE, Tireless and Assassin's Blade allows you to just run from ad to ad mowing them down. Relentless Strikes is also fine if you're planning on hitting the same target more than once. One For All is okay, but I personally prefer Assassin's. Jagged Edge is what you want here. Recommended MW: Impact.
data.name: Quickfang

data.description: Kill Clip and Swash are your primary dmg options for Tigerspite. You can choose to pair this with either Subsistence, Ambitious or Overflow. My recommended Barrels are Arrowhead / Fluted and for Mags you can go Armor Piercing / Flared. Demo is also an option if you want to opt into Nade builds. Recommended MW: Range.
data.name: Tigerspite

data.description: While lacking the traditional best Scout perks, Pleiades is still serviceable with Multikill Clip for dmg & Demo for Nade builds. You'll want to pair this with Outlaw, Surplus or Subsistence in that order of preference. Arrowhead / Fluted are my recommended Barrels and High Cal / Flared is best for Mags. Recommended MW: Stability.
data.name: Pleiades Corrector

data.description: Interesting Bow with Adagio as best dmg option. You can also opt into something like Dragonfly if you want or Demo for Nade builds. Archer's Tempo is the main go to in the 3rd column. Elastic String is your best String, but Polymer is also fine. Fiberglass / Straight Fletching for Arrows. Shoot to Loot is a nice perk that can work well if you're good at utilizing it. Recommended MW: Draw Time.
data.name: Wolftone Draw

data.description: You're mainly just using this for Eager Edge. Also a pretty rare drop.
data.name: The Other Half

data.description: You're mainly just using this for Eager Edge.
data.name: Half-Truths

data.description: Rapid Hit is an amazing perk on Scouts and you can easily combine this with One For All. Kill Clip is a fine 2nd option for dmg and you can opt into Disruption Break for Match Game content. Personally I think the ideal Scope is Flash HS5 / Candle PS, but this ends up being preference. High Cal / Flared are my preferred Mags, but Armor Piercing is solid for Match Game / Barrier Champs. Recommended MW: Handling.
data.name: Eternal Blazon

data.description: Very fun Sword that can roll Cold Steel. Though very niche in most content you can totally mess around with Stasis builds around this. You'd want to pair Cold Steel with Relentless Strikes ideally and Swordmaster's Guard, though Guard doesn't really matter as long as you avoid Heavy. Jagged Edge is best, but Honed is your 2nd option here. Recommended MW: Impact.
data.name: Zephyr

data.description: Demo + Adren Junkie is probably the best combination for this gun if you're running Nade builds. I really want Blunt Execution Rounds to be good, but they're just not. Arrowhead / Fluted are my recommended Barrels here along with Accurized / Ricochet for Mags. Recommended MW: Range.
data.name: BxR-55 Battler

data.description: Fortissimo is a pretty solid slug Shotgun, I'd personally like to run Perp Motion / Subsistence / Threat Detector on it and pair it with dmg options such as Vorpal / Frenzy. Demo + Adren Junkie is also a solid option for Nade builds. I also think Adagio has a place here. Arrowhead / Fluted are my preferred Barrels along with Assault / Tactical for Mags. Recommended MW: Range / Handling.
data.name: Fortissimo-11

data.description: Ever since they nerfed Whirlwind Blade, Vorpal is now the preferred option here. You'll want Jagged Edge and Relentless Strikes to pair with it though.
data.name: Crown-Splitter

data.description: My go to here is Smallbore, Accurized and Short Action Stock as it gives a nice bump to Handling while also providing you 97 Range.
data.name: Osteo Striga

data.description: Frenzy on Tigerspite isn't the highest damage option, but it basically maxes out Handling & Reload. You'd want to pair Frenzy with Overflow / Subsistence / Ambitious. Arrowhead / Fluted would be my recommended Barrels and Armor Piercing / Flared for Mags. Recommended MW: Range.
data.name: Tigerspite

data.description: For Arc Logic I think you're either opting into Adren Junkie for damage, while Demo is for Nade builds. You'd want to pair Adren Junkie or Demo with Feeding Frenzy, Subsistence or Overflow. Frenzy is an option if with Subsistence / Overflow. Arrowhead / Fluted are my recommended Barrels and Accurized / Flared for Mags. Recommended MW: Range.
data.name: Arc Logic

data.description: For general usage Kill Clip is what you'd want here and ideally you'd pair it with Perpetual Motion, but Outlaw is also fine. Demo can work, but mostly you'd want that with Adren Junkie for Nade builds. Arrowhead / Fluted are my recommended Barrels and Accurized / Ricochet for Mags. Recommended MW: Range.
data.name: BxR-55 Battler

data.description: Demo + Adren Junkie is a very potent perk combinations for Nade builds. Personally I don't spec into them too often, but this just ends up being a personal preference thing. For Barrels I'd recommend Arrowhead / Fluted and for Mags, Assault / Tactical. Recommended MW: Range / Handling.
data.name: Fortissimo-11

data.description: Strong Slug shotgun for PvP as it can have some pretty solid rolls. Fluted / Hammerforged are your preferred Barrels and you'd want either Accurized or Assault Mag. Personally I'd go for Perpetual Motion here, but Surplus is also good. Opening Shot and Adagio are by far your best options in the 4th column. Recommended MW: Range.
data.name: Fortissimo-11

data.description: Rapid Hit is an amazing perk on Scouts and you can easily combine this with One For All. Kill Clip is a fine 2nd option for dmg and you can opt into Disruption Break for Match Game content. Personally I think the ideal Scope is Flash HS5 / Candle PS, but this ends up being preference. High Cal / Flared are my preferred Mags, but Armor Piercing is solid for Match Game / Barrier Champs. Recommended MW: Handling.
data.name: Eternal Blazon

data.description: Very fun weapon for people to build craft around with Stasis and works very well for Ad Clear and to take down stronger enemies when charged up. Less optimal when enemies are spread out, but works very well otherwise.
data.name: Ager's Scepter

data.description: For burst damage this thing hurts a lot, but it takes a while to ramp back up so it's not a reliable sustained DPS weapon. You can nuke champions with this thing though.
data.name: Parasite

data.description: Very good gun for general ad clear and the fact you can change elements makes it very versatile. Very fun to use if your exotic slot isn't already taken up.
data.name: Dead Messenger

data.description: Very fun to use in ad clear scenario's where enemies are grouped up. It's also a menace in PvP due to it being a Special LFR with very high Aim Assist values.
data.name: Lorentz Driver

data.description: A very good bow for general ad clear and you can build craft around the Solar explosions. Good for casual content and high end content when Overload Bow is around as a Seasonal mod.
data.name: Ticuu's Divination

data.description: Very good Sword for all around use and is also very good for DPS scenarios where you can get away with using it.
data.name: The Lament

data.description: Amazing weapon for Ad clear and zone control. For both high end and casual content this is a very potent tool to use. It's less suited for scenario's where Ads are more spread out though and shines in scenarios where they're grouped together or have predictable spawns. Can also be used as a secondary DPS weapon in some situations. Only one person can use this though as more than 1 person sticking a combatant with it will not do additional damage.
data.name: Witherhoard

data.description: Does respectable DPS and can also be used for ad clear from a safe distance and in a way traditional Rocket Launcher's can't. Very fun to use.
data.name: Deathbringer

data.description: For many boss encounters this is basically the best gun to use that very few actually wants to use. Of course having more than 1 is detrimental, but just having 1 is a big boost to your teams overall damage in a DPS phase.
data.name: Divinity

data.description: Nanites is pretty good for ad clear and will also deal with major enemies pretty well. Very good Exotic Primary to use overall.
data.name: Outbreak Perfected

data.description: Pairing this with an Auto-Loading Rocket Launcher makes this thing a menace for DPS and is a piece of the highest DPS methods in the game.
data.name: Izanagi's Burden

data.description: Primarily used for DPS and is very good at it. Mostly not used due to the zoom values and other weapons being preferred atm, though this may change in the future.
data.name: Whisper of the Worm

data.description: Very strong weapon against Taken enemies and can be paired with the Hunter Exotic, Lucky Pants for high damage values in general.
data.name: Malfeasance

data.description: Very good Exotic LFR for DPS scenario's and even for casual content it's a good pick as Sleeper has a way higher non precision damage multiplier so it's very forgiving for not hitting precision shots.
data.name: Sleeper Simulant

data.description: Having a pre nerfed version of Rampage makes this gun pretty potent and enables it to do a lot more damage than you'd think. Also got a Zoom buff in Season 17 which makes it a lot stronger.
data.name: The Huckleberry

data.description: A gun that can be used well for most things, basically a Jack of All Trades, Master of None type of weapon. Well known to cause bugs in the game to Bungies misery.
data.name: Telesto

data.description: A very simple, fun to use Exotic that does exactly what you expect it to. Isn't as effective in most higher end content as you have other priorities, but everywhere else a very solid gun that you can build craft around.
data.name: Sunshot

data.description: A very solid Exotic SMG for content that involves a lot of Arc damage. Most Fallen weapons and Hive melee attacks are Arc. Can be very fun to use in strikes such as Fallen Saber and Devil's Lair.
data.name: Riskrunner

data.description: As the only 720 rpm Void Auto available at the moment this weapon has some merit. Kill Clip / Swash are your only dmg options, but you have Demo for Nade builds. The only perk in the 3rd column worth using is Outlaw. Arrowhead / Fluted are my recommended Barrels and for Mags I'd say go for Armor Piercing / Ricochet. Recommended MW: Range.
data.name: Reckless Oracle

data.description: Decent option for DPS scenario's. Focused Fury is the highest dmg buff, but Vorpal / Frenzy are also very good. With Fourth Times you'll want a Mag size of 6 which can get with either Assault / Tactical Mag, or just a Backup Mag Mod, Avoid 7. For Barrels I'd recommend Arrowhead / Fluted. Recommended MW: Range / Handling.
data.name: Fortissimo-11

data.description: Chain Reaction is neat on Grenade Launchers and Field Prep will allow you to hold more reserves. Spike Grenades is a must and Hard Launch is preferred, but Quick Launch is also fine. Recommended MW: Reload / Handling.
data.name: Tarnation

data.description: Currently our only Arc Linear, you'll have to live with some sub par perks on Tarantula. You'll have to live with Box Breathing or Kill Clip here, but Field Prep is solid in the 3rd column. Genesis can work if you're only using this for Match Game. For Barrels I'd recommend Arrowhead / Fluted and for Batteries I'd go Enhanced / Liquid / Accelerated. Recommended MW: Reload / Handling.
data.name: Tarantula

data.description: You can get some weird combinations on this one, personally I'd prefer going for something like Dragonfly / Rampage and Archer's Tempo / Explosive Head. For Strings I'd go Elastic / Polymer and Fiberglass / Straight Fletching for Arrows. Recommended MW: Draw Time / Accuracy.
data.name: Arsenic Bite-4b

data.description: Quickdraw and Auto-Loading is a pretty neat combo for a Blinding Grenade Launcher. For Barrels I'd recommend Quick Launch / Smart Drift. Recommended MW: Velocity.
data.name: Orewing's Maul

data.description: A lightweight Veist Sidearm that can get the fun combo of Stats For All + One For All. Very potent combo and I'd recommend Fluted / Corkscrew for Barrels and Flared / Tactical for Mags. Recommended MW: Range.
data.name: Redback-5si

data.description: Perp Motion is alright if you didn't get Stats For All combined with One For All. Surrounded is okay, but in the end a worse option than OFA. For Barrels I'd recommend Fluted / Cork and Flared / Tactical for Mags. Recommended MW: Range.
data.name: Redback-5si

data.description: Frenzy is your main damage option here and while you can opt into Impulse Amplifier, I strongly prefer Archer's Tempo in the 3rd column. For Strings I'd recommend Elasting / Polymer and for Arrows I'd go for Fiberglass / Straight Fletching. Recommended MW: Draw Time / Accuracy.
data.name: Imperial Needle

data.description: Mostly I prefer this one for 1-2 Punch builds, but you can also opt into Swash if you want it for dmg. Pulse Monitor / Grave Robber / Auto-Loading pair well with these perks. For Barrels I'd recommend Barrel Shroud / Corkscrew and for Mags I'd go Assault / Tactical. Recommended MW: Range.
data.name: Xenoclast IV

data.description: Overflow / Threat Detector feels really nice to work with. I really like to pair this with Frenzy, but Kill Clip also works. Adren Junkie is good for Nade builds and Swash / Surrounded is okay if you want that. Grave Robber is also very good when paired with Swashbuckler. Recommended Barrels: Fluted / Cork and for Mags I'd recommend Flared / Light Mag. MW: Stability / Reload.
data.name: Punching Out

data.description: Overflow / Threat Detector feels really nice to work with. I really like to pair this with Frenzy, but Kill Clip also works. Adren Junkie is good for Nade builds and Swash / Surrounded is okay if you want that. Recommended Barrels: Fluted / Cork and for Mags I'd recommend Flared / Light Mag. Recommended MW: Range.
data.name: Punching Out
